title: Italian typeface circa 1400-1500
content:
Hello all,

Trying to find an appropriate typeface to use for a book I'm designing.  
Looking for an Italian typeface from around 1400-1500.  
So far I only really have Bembo in my palette, so I thought I'd see if you good people could offer any further suggestions whilst I continue my research.

Thank you,  
Sam
author: sambaldwin

comments.content:
In general you're looking for a Venetian font:  
Adobe's Jenson Pro is one, Nick Shinn's Goodchild is another. The field is wide... do you want "authentic look" or "inspired by"?

See:  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/subclasses/serif\_venetian/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/subclasses/serif_venetian/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/subclasses/serif\_venetian/")

Thanks John. Good lead with the Venetian serifs, I'll take a look.

An authentic look isn't particularly required, I was just wanting to look at the authentic ones to better understand the characteristics. I've come across a lot of interesting revivals of Italian faces of the time which I may consider using too.

Thanks again

Centaur is a great one--a redesign of Nicolas Jenson's work, and is considered a Venetian Renaissance font. Designed (if I remember correctly) in the 1920s by Bruce Rogers. Does great in display (as the header for the Metropolitan Museum of Modern Art) as well as in print (for a long time Rogers used it exclusively himself on small, fine art books).
If you want a really distinctive look check out P22’s revival of Benton’s [Cloister Oldstyle](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/p22.com/lanston/cloister.html).

I once read a great history book set in [Requiem](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100020), and I remember the type choice enhancing my reading experience.

If you want a different approach, here's a couple of contemporary takes on the Venetian:

[Augustin](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/ludwiguebele/augustin/)  
 [Eason](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fountain/eason_pro/)

Maybe we can add the newly-released [Calluna](http://web.archive.org/web/20120103163014/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/exljbris/calluna/) to the list.
